intro: Davilla microcalyx, commonly known as the small-fruited davisia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It produces small, round fruits that are typically covered in fine hairs. Davilla microcalyx is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
